snippet: President Xi Jinping faces the daunting task of reconciling promises of market-driven economic reform with his goal to reinforce the Communist Party’s pillars of control.
abstract: China’s Pres Xi Jinping is poised to plunge country and himself into risky experiment of attempting to carry out market-driven economic overhauls while reinforcing Communist Party’s pillars of political and ideological control; mixed agenda has magnified doubts about whether he can deliver on his promises of transformation.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping faces the daunting task of reconciling promises of market-driven economic reform with his goal to reinforce the Communist Party’s pillars of control.

headline.main: Chinese Leader’s Economic Plan Tests Goal to Fortify Party Power
headline.print_headline: A Clash of Goals For China’s Leader
